text.name: transcodeWebPage
text.description: Acquire precise webpage details or real-time search engine responses based on user-input content.

link.description: This parameter takes either a URL or a non-URL string. If a URL is given, the model will engage with the designated webpage to collect or interact with its data. If a non-URL string is given, the model will handle it as a search inquiry and try to find related real-time news or information. To guarantee the best results, make sure the input is a valid URL or a succinct search query.

text.name: transcodeWebPage
text.description: Acquire precise webpage details or real-time search engine responses based on user-input content.

link.description: This parameter takes either a URL or a non-URL string. If a URL is given, the model will engage with the designated webpage to collect or interact with its data. If a non-URL string is given, the model will handle it as a search inquiry and try to find related real-time news or information. To guarantee the best results, make sure the input is a valid URL or a succinct search query.

text.name: categories
text.description: Retrieves all categories. Display results using markdown.

text.name: assets
text.description: Retrieves all assets that match the filters specified by the args. Please specify the search target and fuzzy search is not supported now.

count.description: The count of results to return. The max value of count is 50.

offset.description: The start offset of results to return.

keywords.description: Used to filter assets based on their name.

categoryIds.description: Filter by category ids. Category ids can be determined using the getCategories function.

colors.description: Used to filter assets based on their color.

tags.description: Used to filter assets based on their tags.

min_polygon.description: The minimal count of polygons in the asset.

max_polygon.description: The max count of polygons in the asset.

animated.description: true or false. This is used to select assets that has animation or not.

free.description: true or false. This is used to select assets is free or not.

rigged.description: true or false. This is used to select assets that has rigged or not.

text.name: getNews
text.description: Retrieves the latest news whose content contains the query string.

query.description: Used to query news articles on their title and body. For example, ?query=apple will return news stories that have 'apple' in their title or body.

text.name: getStep
text.description: Get the guide for the specified step in the plugin building process.

step.description: The step number in the plugin building process.

aggregator.description: Aggregators can be used to reduce extra data nestingLevels into aggregate values for display as outer nesting levels.

nestingLevels.description: nestingLevels describe the shape of the data array by naming each nesting level (Years, Employees, etc), and by assigning labels to each datum at that level (2009, John Smith)

data.description: Data is a nested array of numbers. Each nesting level must be declared as an entry in the 'nestingLevels' property.

scale.description: Value scale for Line Charts, (Stacked) Area Charts, and (Stacked) Bar Charts. Has no effect on Pie or Donut Charts.

notes.description: Notes about the chart, such as a description of the data or a citation.

text.name: getLatestNews
text.description: Users can request real-time news updates or categorized news. Each news item comes with a link and date, and users can ask for more information at the end of the content.

isToday.description: If the content mentions a word related to 'today', then it is true, otherwise it is false.

language.description: Determine the user locale based on their language, using the format of language code in ISO-639 format, for example, 'zh' for Chinese.

country.description: Determine the user locale based on their language, using the country code in ISO-3166 format, for example, 'TW' for Taiwan.

category.description: If the user mentions related keyword in any languages, use the corresponding category ('business', 'finance', 'economics', 'politics', 'society', 'entertainment', 'fun', 'gossip', 'sports', 'lifestyle', 'technology', 'local', 'world', 'international', 'global', 'military') as a category parameter. If the user does not mention any specific keyword, the default value for the category parameter is an empty string.

keyword.description: Based on the context, infer the keywords that the user wants to search for. If there are no matching keywords, default to an empty string.

text.name: GenerateAsciiArt
text.description: Convert text to ASCII art, acepted characters A to Z a to z 0 to 9  - and _
The text to be converted, example fonts are doom, graffiti, avatar, big, bulbhead, chunky, cybermedium, epic, graceful, small, double, for full list of fonts ask for List of all available fonts

font.description: The font style for the ASCII art (default standard)

url.description: The URL to generate a QR code from.

text.name: transcodeWebPage
text.description: Acquire precise webpage details or real-time search engine responses based on user-input content.

link.description: This parameter takes either a URL or a non-URL string. If a URL is given, the model will engage with the designated webpage to collect or interact with its data. If a non-URL string is given, the model will handle it as a search inquiry and try to find related real-time news or information. To guarantee the best results, make sure the input is a valid URL or a succinct search query.

text.name: transcribeVideo
text.description: Transcribe a section of a video

videoId.description: YouTube video ID to be transcribed

segment.description: Segment number to transcribe, with each segment holding a maximum of 2k words.

includeTimestamp.description: Specifies whether to include timestamps in the transcription

includeTimestamp.description: Specifies whether to include timestamps in the transcription

text.name: search_product_product_post
text.description: Searches Google Shopping API for a product and returns product details. TBS (to be searched) parameter defines advanced search parameters that aren't possible in the regular query field.

tbs.title: Tbs
tbs.description: The 'tbs' (to be searched) parameter defines advanced search parameters. For example, use 'mr:1,buy:g' to filter for 'Buy on Google', or 'mr:1,local_avail:1,ss:55' for 'Available nearby'

text.name: getHbarBalance
text.description: Get the HBAR balance of a specific Hedera account

account_id.description: The ID of the Hedera account

text.name: getSingleTokenBalance
text.description: Get the balance of Hedera account for a single token ID

account_id.description: The ID of the Hedera account

token_id.description: The token ID of the HTS Token

text.name: getAllTokensList
text.description: Get the list of all the tokens that the Hedera account owns and is associated with.

account_id.description: The ID of the Hedera account

text.name: geTransactionsPerSecond
text.description: Get the number of transactions per second (TPS) being processed by the Hedera network.

text.name: getNftsMintedLastXDays
text.description: Get the number of NFTs minted on Hedera in the last one or more days. The number of days is provided by the user.

num_days.description: The number of days for which NFTs minted is retrieved

text.name: getNftsMintedLastXHours
text.description: Get the number of NFTs minted on Hedera in the last 24 hours or less. The number of hours is provided by the user.

num_hours.description: The number of hours for which NFTs minted is retrieved
